intro: Tetranthera mogol, commonly known as Mongolian tetranthera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible species. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that have prominent veins. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late summer. Tetranthera mogol is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
